data.title: SEA OF GLASS by Longyear, Barry B.: (1987) First edition.
data.meta_description: First edition. - Hardcover - St. Martin's Press [1987], New York - 1987 - Dust Jacket Included - Octavo, boards. "Longyear's most powerful novel and one of the grimmest stories of overpopulation ever written. When seven-year-old Thomas Windom's parents are discovered to have committed the crime of having an illegal child in the grossly overpopulated twenty-first century, they are put to death gruesomely on public television, and Thomas is sent to spend the rest of his life in a brutal labor camp." - Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-679. [Reference: Sargent, British and American Utopian Literature 1986-2009]. A fine copy in fine dust jacket. (#169381) (30019) - SEA OF GLASS
